dialogues.text: Well? You in, or are you too much of a bitch? The Hells Angels freeze. Jack grits his teeth in rage and turns back to Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Let's party, tough guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Doug nods, trying to look confidant, but it's quickly fading away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG and JACK are standing "in their corners," opposite each other in the dirt parking lot. They're surrounded by a circle of Hells Angels, rowdily waiting for the fight to commence. WOODY and BOB coach Doug in his corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stay clear of the big punches. You've got more stamina than this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. When do I hit back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... Just try and get him tired. I don't think punches will do much to him. Doug gives Woody a concerned look. Woody shrugs. Jack steps into the circle and throws off his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for your beating, yuppie!
"Wild Hogs" writers first draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell my wife I won - then got hit by a truck. Doug takes a deep breath and starts into the circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Let's do this-- Doug doesn't even finish his sentence as Jack lands a punch on the side of his head. Doug is stunned, as Jack sends his other fist crashing into Doug's forehead. Doug goes flying backwards, and falls down in the dirt. The Hells Angels cheer. Jack high fives them as Doug struggles back to his feet and looks back at Woody and Bob, cradling his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Dammit Jesus that hurt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It really hurts. Damn! Jack comes back over to Doug. Jack throws another right, but this time Doug ducks, still cradling his jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!-- But Doug is instantly punched in the stomach by Jack's other fist. Doug winces as he doubles over in agony. Drool drips out of his mouth. This isn't pretty. Jack takes him by the back of the shirt and lifts him into the air. The Hells Angels cheer as Jack tosses Doug five yards into the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get tired yet. The hurt is just beginning. Doug tries to stand back up, but it's getting harder. He slyly grabs a handful of sand as he starts to stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah! Doug whips around and throws the sand towards Jack's face; However, his aim is off. The sand hits Jack in the chest and falls away. Jack looks at Doug and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Jack punches Doug square in the face again. Doug crumples to the ground in pain. Jack turns back to the Hells Angels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, this isn't even a workout. Jack laughs and puts his aviator sunglasses back on, as Doug quickly stands up and whips around at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh! Doug throws another handful of sand. This time he aims carefully; but Jack now has sunglasses on. The sand bounces harmlessly off the lenses. Doug cringes and waits for the punch, which comes like a freight train into his stomach. Doug doubles over again as Jack lines up another punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's gonna break bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait-- Doug straightens up and looks curiously at Jack's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your tooth-- That's an acute periodontal abscess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: look, I really hate you, but I don't want to feel responsible for a death. I'm a dentist. I took an oath. Same one as doctors. If the infection in that tooth gets to the root - it could seep into your nervous system. Just let me look-- Doug slowly reaches towards Jack's mouth. Jack doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a dentist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. One of the best. And I know when your gums are that swollen and your

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Wham! Doug punches Jack square in the mouth. Jack goes down hard. Woody and Bob cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Doug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick! Start kicking him! Don't let him get up! Doug nods and goes to kick Jack, but Jack grabs the foot and pushes him backwards. Doug falls back to the dirt. Jack stands up and dusts himself off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Now you're going to die. Jack approaches Doug, who closes his eyes and waits for the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!! Jack turns around as WOODY walks into the circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug's not the leader of this gang. I-- Jack instantly punches Woody in the face. Woody falls down next to Doug. Doug turns his head to Woody. They're both bleeding from their noses and lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Jack looks at Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody else the leader of this gang? Bob takes a deep breath, and bends down an grabs a long lead pipe. He starts towards Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Mother f-- Bob suddenly trips on the lead pipe and hits the ground. Doug shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stay down. Bob nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess that's all of you-- DUDLEY, still covered in tape, comes running into the circle from the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhhhhhh! Dudley charges Jack, but his limited mobility results not in a tackle, but in him leaning on Jack. After a moment, Jack takes a step back and Dudley falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow. Jack cracks his knuckles and looks to OILCAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the crowbar. Oilcan nods and hands it to Jack. Jack smiles at the four fallen Wild Hogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess you guys are wishing you'd listened, now, huh? Jack smiles as we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and the Hells Angels look up the road. ANGLE ON: DOWN STREET. CHARLEY is riding his shiny Harley Davidson police bike. Behind him are BUCK and EARL, driving a police cruiser. Behind the cruiser is a large group of people carrying rakes, hedge clippers, brooms... It's all the citizens of Lucas. ANGLE ON: Hells Angels. They're stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 113. CHARLEY pulls up to the group and gets off his motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Jack. That'll be enough of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? And what makes you think you can ride a motorcycle without our permission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll ride whatever I want from now on. I'm the sheriff of Lucas, and I'm not tolerating any more lawlessness. BOB helps DOUG, WOODY, and DUDLEY to their feet, as Jack takes a step towards Charley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd stop right there, Jack. Earl and Buck get out of the cruiser with two shotguns. They cock the guns and walk to Charley's side. Jack looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You're going to shoot us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not unless you want to do something stupid like ignoring-- Buck grabs his missing ear as he starts to loose his balance. He tips over and falls. As he hits the ground, the shotgun fires and hits OILCAN in the leg. Oilcan falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhh! He shot me! I just got shot!! Charley looks over at Buck, then back to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... Yeah, I guess we're going to shoot you. The Hells Angels suddenly look nervous, and back up a few steps. Charley steps towards Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to live in fear of your gang anymore, Jack. If the Wild Hogs can stand up to you - so can everyone of us. The crowd of townspeople gathers behind Charley and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. You mess up our town, we'll do the same to you! The crowd cheers as THOMAS MILBORN, the guy Earl pointed out as a child molester, steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! People like you are the scum of the earth! The crowd is silent for a moment, then hesitantly gives a uncomfortable cheer. Charley turns back to the Hells Angels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point is, from now on you need to treat Lucas with kindness and respect. And when you do, you'll be treated the same. And if you don't... Charley looks over at OILCAN, who's tending to the bullet wound in his thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I guess we'll keep... shooting you. Got it? Jack looks at all the townspeople. He knows he's beaten. He nods bitterly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Now I'd like you to untape our friend Dudley. Jack signals to one of the Hells Angels. He grabs Dudley's tape and spins him around to untape him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow. Ow! Ow, ow. Ow. Ow!... After a painful minute, Dudley is untaped. Charley looks at Jack's jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I believe that's his jacket. Jack begrudgingly takes off Dudley's "Wild Hogs" jacket and tosses it to him. Dudley proudly puts it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as I recall, that '51 Panhead was traded to Dudley. Jack looks over at the mint condition motorcycle and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. He can have his Sportster back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh uh. A deal's a deal, Jack. Jack grits his teeth and throws a set of keys at Dudley. The crowd chatters in approval as Dudley gets on the '51 Panhead and starts the engine. He revs it a few times and Jack shoots Doug an infuriated glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope you're happy. You suburban posers are a disease. You need to learn some damn respect for real bikers. Doug smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still don't get it do you, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are the real bikers. As Doug says this, Dudley kicks the Panhead into gear and shoots forward - out of control. He instantly crashes into a steel light post. Everyone in the crowd cringes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the bike falls over in a crumpled heap. up from the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll take the Sportster back, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 116. Jack just stares at the trashed motorcycle, mortified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's later that afternoon in Lucas. DOUG, BOB and WOODY walk to their motorcycles with CHARLEY, EARL and BUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I wish you guys would stay longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, we should be heading back. I think we've had enough excitement for one trip. Earl steps forward and shakes Doug's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys were a blessing to this place. I mean... I'm not going to get all emotional like "hamburger head" here always does. Earl laughs and looks to his left. Buck isn't there. He quickly looks to the right, where Buck is staring at him in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you just call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a little scar! I'm still better looking than you! Buck goes to storm off, but after a few steps, tilts left and falls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit! Doug shakes his head, then turns to Woody and Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Woody and Bob) You guys ready to head back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 117. Woody takes a deep breath and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? I think I'm going to press on. Keep heading West.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why not? I feel good about my life again. And I'd like to see what San Francisco's all about. Doug nods and looks to Bob. You can tell he wants to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in, too! Let's ride to San-- Suddenly, a mini-van pulls up. KAREN and KELLY hop out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen? / Kelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I was coming, Bob!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, honey. Kelly kisses Doug. He smiles, glad to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, baby. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen said you guys were in trouble. I kept calling your cell, but somebody programmed it to not receive calls from our house. Doug shoots Woody a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Woody hurries over to his bike. KAREN turns to BOB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I hope you guys had a nice trip. Now get in the van. We're going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... Actually, we just decided we were going to keep pressing West for a few--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. No way! I came all the way out here, rented a car, drove to this podunk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen is saying this, Bob looks over at the guys, then back to Karen. He can't take it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Karen! Karen stops talking, shocked by Bob raising his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. This is My vacation and if I want to ride on with my friends, well that's what I'm going to do! And if you have a problem with that, well... Tough shit! There's a moment of silence as Karen absorbs this. The guys all look at Bob proudly. After a few seconds, Karen's face softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Sorry... Just... be careful. Karen shyly kisses Bob on the cheek. Bob can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. And... I love you. Bob smiles at her and gets on his bike. ANGLE ON: DOUG and KELLY. Kelly looks at Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you going, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hadn't really decided. I have been having a good time, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I even got beaten up. Doug winks cockily. Kelly lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is! I saw old Doug! Doug blushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see him even more if you and Billy meet me in San Francisco. We've got a suite at the Ritz-Carlton. Doug smiles and gets onto his motorcycle. Kelly looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about work? And Billy's school? Doug shrugs like he hasn't a care in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh. We can risk it. Kelly smiles and kisses him proudly. Doug grabs her face and kisses her back... Then, turns to Woody and Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. Dudley? What do you think? The camera PULLS OUT to reveal DUDLEY, sitting on his motorcycle. Next to him, is MAGGIE, sitting in the rusty sidecar now attached to Dudley's bike. She's wearing Dudley's goggles and nods to him encouragingly. Dudley looks back over to Doug, Bob and Woody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's ride. They start their motorcycles. The engines roar to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four motorcycles (and one sidecar) cruise down the open highway. The guys smile as the wind blows in their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 120. It's freedom, joy and friendship all wrapped up in one expression. The camera PANS AROUND THEM, and finally ZOOMS IN ON DOUG. We see his eyes sparkle a little bit, and he opens his mouth:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I walk these streets, a loaded six string on my back. I play for keeps, 'cause I might not make it back... I'm a cowboy, on a steel horse I ride! I'm wanted... The other guys smile and join in:

dialogues.speaker: DOUG/BOB/WOODY/DUDLEY
dialogues.text: Dead or alive! They all look at each other as they continue to sing over the roar of the engines:

dialogues.speaker: DOUG/BOB/WOODY/DUDLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ohh, I'm a cowboy, I got the night on my side!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wante-ee--ed!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG/BOB/WOODY/DUDLEY
dialogues.text: Dead or aliiiivvvee!

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC CUE
dialogues.text: The camera slowly PULLS OUT TO AN AERIAL SHOT, as the guys joyfully ride along the sunlit highway. It's a good day to be a Wild Hog.
